summary: Civil rights, as delineated within the framework of EU legal and regulatory documents, encompass the fundamental rights and freedoms inherent to all individuals. These rights are enshrined in various EU treaties and charters, notably the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union. Civil rights include, but are not limited to, the right to equality, freedom of expression, and the right to a fair trial. The EU actively promotes the protection and enforcement of civil rights across member states, ensuring compliance with established norms and standards. This commitment underscores the EU's dedication to upholding democratic principles and safeguarding individual liberties within its jurisdiction.
